input_text:
Job Title: Forklift Operator

Location: Maple Grove, MN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Shift: This role is 3rd Shift, 7:00 PM-7:00 AM

Hourly Rate: $23.40 an hour + $0.75 shift differential

Shift Schedule

Scheduled to work 12 hour shifts from 7pm - 7am every Monday and Tuesday, and every other Friday, Saturday, Sunday, which is a 2 week pattern of 2 days on, 2 days off, 5 days on, 5 days off. Every other weekend is scheduled work time. Only scheduled to work 15 days every month, but with built-in overtime pay!

Payrate : $23.40 - $25.65 depending on experience.

Job Summary

You will loads/unloads all trailers of raw materials & finished goods, prepare proper paperwork for shipping or receiving, supply presses with materials & account for inventoried materials. Additionally, you will keep warehouse in order; maintain aisles & exits clear of all material. You will report to the Supply Chain Manager and will receive work direction from the Warehouse and shift lead onsite in our Maple Grove facility.

Job Duties

You will operate all equipment in department i.e. forklifts, sit-down, and clamp. Change forklift batteries.You will assist with cycle counting and bin verification.Complete UPS shipment documentation.Stage shipment to go out including using SAP to enter staged information.Complete assigned tasks for the Master Sanitation schedule.Verify the visitor's log book is filled out completely.Move pallets of material, finished roll stock, and metal drums of ink as frequently for production. Moving of materials is done manually with the assistance of a forklift and with non-powered material handling equipment.Remove finished, rewind, and scrap material from all machines.Stock the production supply rack.Supply production machines with packaging materials such as cores, pallets, cardboard.Remove and set up the bailed recycled material.Supply presses with rolls of paper.Unload incoming materials from trailers & LTLs.Verify that all materials received match vendor's bill of lading and process the necessary paperwork.Pull glue samples from tanker for testing and pump the glue from the tanker.Load finished product on trailers and prepare the paperwork required for shipping.Receive and inventory packages from small truck carriers.Other duties as assigned.


Qualifications/Education/Experience

High School diploma or GED required.Operate forklift equipment â€“ 1 year experience in a manufacturing environment.Ability to lift up to 50 poundsWalk, standing, sitting, twisting, climbingRead & write EnglishPerform basic math functionsPerform computer navigation (SAP, Microsoft Office)Teamwork is required


Anticipated Close Date: June 15, 2024

Location: Maple Grove, Minnesota

Our Benefits

We care about your total well-being and will support you with the following, subject to your location and role:

Health: Medical, dental and vision insurance, company-paid life, accident and disability insuranceWealth: great pay, 401(k) and stock purchase planGrowth: online courses, virtual and on-site development experiencesBalance: paid-time off


Our Company

Conagra Brands is one of North America's leading branded food companies. Guided by an entrepreneurial spirit, our Company combines a rich heritage of making great food with a sharpened focus on innovation. Our portfolio is evolving to satisfy people's changing food preferences. Our iconic brands, such as Birds Eye, Duncan Hines, Healthy Choice, Marie Callender's, Reddi-wip, and Slim Jim, and emerging brands, including Angie's BOOMCHICKAPOP, Duke's, Earth Balance, Gardein, and Frontera, offer choices for every occasion.

We pride ourselves on having the most impactful, energized and inclusive culture in the food industry. For more information, visit www.conagrabrands.com.

Conagra Brands is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, ethnic or national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, pregnancy, leave status, disability, veteran status, genetic information and/or any other characteristic or status protected by national, federal, state or local law.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: Forklift Operator
output_json.summary: This role is for a Forklift Operator working 3rd Shift in Maple Grove, MN.

Prepares proper paperwork for shipping or receiving
Supplies presses with materials & accounts for inventoried materials
Keeps warehouse in order; maintains aisles & exits clear of all material
Operates all equipment in department (forklifts, sit-down, and clamp)
Assists with cycle counting and bin verification
Stages shipment to go out including using SAP to enter staged information
Verifies that all materials received match vendor's bill of lading and processes necessary paperwork
Pulls glue samples from tanker for testing and pumps the glue from the tanker
Loads finished product on trailers and prepares paperwork required for shipping
Receives and inventories packages from small truck carriers
benefits: Company-paid life, accident, and disability insurance
Great pay, 401(k), and stock purchase plan
Online courses, virtual, and on-site development experiences
